Summary: Two UFOs appear to be in the vicinity of shuttle Discovery on landing approach
divs:
sighting detailsi was reading the good news that discovery returned safely to earth today. whilst watching the linked footage below i noticed something unusual. unusual in as much that, to my knowledge, there shouldn't be anything else up in the air in the vicinity of the shuttle when it lands. yet, at two distinct places in the footage, there do appear to be (technically) ufos. i found the best way to view them is to go to full screen mode. the first object appears at about 7 seconds from the right of the frame. it's in the frame for less than a second so you'll have to use the 'pause' button a lot. the second object appears from the lower left part of the screen at about 11 seconds and isn't there for very long either. i'm assuming they're not helicopters (dangerous and i thought used more for the older sea landings?), other planes (banned as far as i know), birds (too big), or balloons (danger and why??), aerial attachments to poles \ pylons (no poles \ pylons) visible. maybe there is a perfectly logical explanation (although i class ufos as buzzing shuttles logical, however... ;) ) ? have you any ideas what the objects are or might be? i thought i'd send the footage to you before the objects get airbrushed out ;) a point worth noting is that ufo (visual) encounters with the shuttles and their crew whilst in orbit are, apparently, regular and, again, 'according to sources', considered 'normal' by those charged with monitoring the shuttle from earth. this is the direct link: http:\news.bbc.co.uk\player
ol

ewsid_7083600\7083663.stm?bw=bb&mp=wm&asb=1&news=1&ms3=22 if that doesn't work go to the main bbc news page and look for the vid link http:\news.bbc.co.uk\ if none of those work then the airbrushers have got to it first ;)
